quest.name: On Burdεned ωings
journal: Despite Meteion's words, Urianger cannot accept his comrade is gone.
objectives: Search for the source of the dragons' woes in Ahm Nohl.
Search for a dragonet near Ahm Nohl.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I understand now why the Loporrits were surprised to find that this environment could sustain life. There but for Thancred's sacrifice...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: He can't really be gone, can he? Meteion herself said his soul persists, that he is the reason we are still breathing. If so then maybe...maybe...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: His will was strong enough to reshape Ultima Thule that we might survive. That I might see again. His sacrifice must not be wasted.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: It's hard to believe Thancred was able to overcome Meteion's will. Yet here we are... Would that the price for his victory had not been so high.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: My aim was true. I had her.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: How are we to defeat an enemy we can't attack?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Soul without body... A form of being with which we are not wholly unfamiliar.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Indeed, for we existed in a similar state when residing in the First.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: The circumstances are rather more dire than that, 'tis true, but I choose to believe he is not forever lost to us.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Regardless...in sacrifice he hath afforded us a chance to prevail. Let us not squander it, and ascertain the nature of this realm that we might confront and defeat Meteion.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Estinien. Forename. Would you accompany me in speaking with these dragons? Mayhap they can enlighten us.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: I would ask the rest of you to survey these surrounds. If there is a path that may lead us to our quarry, we must find it.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Very well. We can reconvene here when everyone has finished.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Meteion said these dragons are shadow and shade, from a world whose denizens sought oblivion.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: As such, they're not like to be amenable to company, let alone conversation. So please, be careful.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Let us split up and gather what knowledge we may.

dialogue.name: SEIHLOSKH
dialogue.text: A visitor. Not of this star...

dialogue.name: SEIHLOSKH
dialogue.text: Could thy slender hands bring plague to our world... Thy breath extinguish life's feeble flame... Oh, how we would adore thee. Alas...

dialogue.name: SEIHLOSKH
dialogue.text: With time our flesh shall wither, our souls fade. And so we wait for its inexorable march unto oblivion.

dialogue.name: SEIHLOSKH
dialogue.text: If thou art not come to hasten our demise, I bid thee leave us. We crave not companionship. Only silence.

dialogue.name: SEIHLOSKH
dialogue.text: I pray thee leave us to our silence. To break it serves only to mark time's passage. We shall not suffer reminders of its flow.

dialogue.name: KOHMNOSKH
dialogue.text: Beyond that distant veil... Paradise lost. So glorious. So beautiful...

dialogue.name: KOHMNOSKH
dialogue.text: We were a proud and noble race. Strength embodied. We knew only love. Before they came...

dialogue.name: KOHMNOSKH
dialogue.text: Metal monstrosities of black and silver. No bonds of blood did they share, nor conviction did they have to guide them.

dialogue.name: KOHMNOSKH
dialogue.text: A crushing defeat. Never had we known such shame... Stilled now are the winds, though none could fill these wings burdened by ignominy. We fly no more, only sink into oblivion...

dialogue.name: KOHMNOSKH
dialogue.text: I beg thee leave me to dream. To forget that which we have lost...

dialogue.name: WHEIFEHSK
dialogue.text: Thou wouldst bid me speak? Hmph. Folly.

dialogue.name: WHEIFEHSK
dialogue.text: I observe the lesson of stone. I shall not fly, nor speak, nor roar. Only watch, and wait, and end.

dialogue.name: WHEIFEHSK
dialogue.text: But one sight yet stirreth my blood, tempteth me to raise my voice in lamentation: Ahm Nohl, the cradle of unsung dragons.

dialogue.name: WHEIFEHSK
dialogue.text: No words, no songs are possessed of the weight to describe such tragedy... Go, if that be thy will. I shall remain.

dialogue.name: WHEIFEHSK
dialogue.text: Stay and ponder the lesson, or go in ignorant defiance.

dialogue.name: WHEIFEHSK
dialogue.text: I remain...for I dare not look upon Ahm Nohl, font of our greatest loss...

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: They led you here as well, did they? It was described to me as the source of their woes and proof of their end. I think I'm beginning to see why.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: It's a hatching ground. Or, was... I've seen similar on Etheirys.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Midgardsormr's kind must once have lived and thrived in a place such as this.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Vrtra said his father was driven from their ancestral home by war and strife. This, then, is the fate of those who remained.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Let's have a look around. Maybe these eggs have more to tell of what happened here.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: The stench of these eggs is as fierce as any weapon. Would that there were winds to carry it away.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Inside the shattered egg you find the remains of an unborn dragon. The body has already begun to decompose.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The gelatinous, half-dried membrane covering the corpse suggests it failed to emerge...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A murky liquid has pooled inside this egg shell. The noxious foetor is indicative of contamination...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Gingerly lifting a large egg from the viscous mire, you peer inside and see a formless mass soaking in a pool of embryonic fluid.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Your stomach turns as you return the egg to its resting place.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This egg appears to have been broken from the inside out. Perhaps the dragonet within succeeded in hatching...

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: What's this? I thought all the eggs had been ruined.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: If the dragonet was indeed hatched, there is no sign of it here─or its sire, for that matter.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: We should look for them. You start with the clifftops, and I'll search the plains.

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Gwoooar!

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Gwoooh... <gurgle>

dialogue.name: ELDERDRAGON04454
dialogue.text: The boisterous howling hath been quieted... By thy hand, I presume.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Everything all right? I thought I heard a dragon, or something resembling one.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Ah. I see what's happened here... Was that your child?

dialogue.name: ELDERDRAGON04454
dialogue.text: Perhaps. Some eggs within Ahm Nohl are indeed mine. If life within one did quicken, the beast thou hast slain may be of my blood.

dialogue.name: ELDERDRAGON04454
dialogue.text: Yet I do not recognize it, twisted and malformed as it is.

dialogue.name: ELDERDRAGON04454
dialogue.text: Not a dragon in truth, but a reminder of our failure. A testament to our shame.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Explain.

dialogue.name: ELDERDRAGON04454
dialogue.text: They descended from the heavens. Cold, heartless machines. And with them rode war and death.

dialogue.name: ELDERDRAGON04454
dialogue.text: With fire and fury, rage and rancor, we gave answer. 'Twas a long and bloody battle, but only the beginning...

dialogue.name: ELDERDRAGON04454
dialogue.text: Untold chaos and destruction swept over the star. In the end, the invaders were victorious.

dialogue.name: ELDERDRAGON04454
dialogue.text: Yet when they looked upon their prize, they deemed it unfit for requisition. We were abandoned to our ruin.

dialogue.name: ELDERDRAGON04454
dialogue.text: The survivors sought to put away their shame. To rebuild. A futile effort.

dialogue.name: ELDERDRAGON04454
dialogue.text: In purest soil replete with aether did we once cultivate our nesting grounds. But our lands were barren, and any eggs nurtured in such desolation were fated to rot.

dialogue.name: ELDERDRAGON04454
dialogue.text: What few survive to hatch emerge as...abominations. We shall have no new progeny.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: But there are dragons among you capable of journeying to other stars.

dialogue.name: ELDERDRAGON04454
dialogue.text: That there are. Many would make the attempt, each bearing a clutch of eggs.

dialogue.name: ELDERDRAGON04454
dialogue.text: The richest stars were home to the harshest rulers, and the arrival of dragons incited contests for supremacy.

dialogue.name: ELDERDRAGON04454
dialogue.text: When the fires faded, the wars lost and won, they too were reduced to ash and waste.

dialogue.name: ELDERDRAGON04454
dialogue.text: 'Tis the curse of those who seek life─to be drawn into conflict, to conquer or be conquered.

dialogue.name: ELDERDRAGON04454
dialogue.text: A vicious cycle we now choose to break. We tire of conflict. Of everything...

dialogue.name: ELDERDRAGON04454
dialogue.text: We wait now in sweet, merciful silence. Free from strife and suffering. Still as stone...

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Wait! You claim your kind is doomed, but there is another star─
